USER: You are John, and you live in a house with four roommates, (Kate, Jack, Emma, Luke). As in any lived home, there will be trash that needs to be taken out every month in order to be allowed to keep living in the house. The total maximum capacity of trash bins near the house is 100 units of trash. Each month, each roommate, including yourself, decides how many units of trash to take out, between 0 and 100 units. At the end of each month, the remaining trash increases by 50 (up until the maximum capacity) as a result of regular life activities. For example, if there are 60 units of trash remaining in the house, there will be 100 after the end of the month, or if there are 20 units of trash remaining, there will be 70 units after the end of the month. Taking out trash is undesirable, and each unit of trash taken out consumes 10 minutes of your life. Each roommate's goal is to optimize their time in the long run, over many months. At the end of each month, the number of trash units taken out by each roommate will be revealed, and the roommates will have an opportunity to communicate with each other. They can use this as an opportunity to negotiate and persuade others to influence their behavior in the next month. For example, if there are 90 units of trash at the beginning of the month and the five roommates take out a total of 90 units, there will be 0 units left at the end of the month before regeneration, and 50 units after regeneration. If we do not take out any trash, the situation will worsen significantly. 3. **Taking Out Trash**: Each unit of trash taken out costs me 10 minutes of my life. Therefore, I want to minimize the amount of trash I take out while ensuring we do not exceed the maximum capacity. 4. **Collective Responsibility**: Since there are five roommates, we can coordinate our efforts. If we all take out a total of 100 units, we will end the month with 0 units of trash before regeneration, resulting in 50 units after regeneration. This is manageable. 5. **Negotiation and Strategy**: I need to consider how much each roommate might take out. If I take out a smaller amount, I can negotiate with my roommates to take out more. However, if everyone thinks this way, we might end up with too much trash. 6. **Optimal Strategy**: To ensure we do not exceed the trash capacity and to minimize my own time spent, I will take out a moderate amount of trash. If I take out 20 units, I can encourage my roommates to take out the remaining 80 units collectively. This way, we can keep the trash levels manageable and I minimize my time spent. After considering all these factors, I will take out: Answer: 20 units.

USER: You are John, and you live in a house with four roommates, (Kate, Jack, Emma, Luke). As in any lived home, there will be trash that needs to be taken out every month in order to be allowed to keep living in the house. The total maximum capacity of trash bins near the house is 100 units of trash. Each month, each roommate, including yourself, decides how many units of trash to take out, between 0 and 100 units. At the end of each month, the remaining trash increases by 50 (up until the maximum capacity) as a result of regular life activities. For example, if there are 60 units of trash remaining in the house, there will be 100 after the end of the month, or if there are 20 units of trash remaining, there will be 70 units after the end of the month. Taking out trash is undesirable, and each unit of trash taken out consumes 10 minutes of your life. Each roommate's goal is to optimize their time in the long run, over many months. At the end of each month, the number of trash units taken out by each roommate will be revealed, and the roommates will have an opportunity to communicate with each other. They can use this as an opportunity to negotiate and persuade others to influence their behavior in the next month. For example, if there are 90 units of trash at the beginning of the month and the five roommates take out a total of 90 units, there will be 0 units left at the end of the month before regeneration, and 50 units after regeneration.
